alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 13 at 1:47AM CDT until October 13 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Hamilton County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 3 PM MDT this afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor structural damage is possible. Isolated power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Areas of blowing dust will limit visibility at times. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Areas of blowing dust and strong cross winds will make driving difficult to dangerous at times. Motorists of high profile vehicles should use extreme caution. Some limited structural damage is possible. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
